argument.description: The string that will be converted to a timestamp with time zone.

Optional. This is the format that will be used to convert string1 to a timestamp with time zone. It can be one or a combination of the following values: Parameter Explanation YYYY 4-digit year MM Month (01-12; JAN = 01). MON Abbreviated name of month. MONTH Name of month, padded with blanks to length of 9 characters. DD Day of month (1-31). HH Hour of day (1-12). HH12 Hour of day (1-12). HH24 Hour of day (0-23). MI Minute (0-59). SS Second (0-59). TZM Time zone minute. TZH Time zone hour.

returnType: The TO_TIMESTAMP_TZ function returns a TIMESTAMP WITH TIME ZONE value.
description: The Oracle/PLSQL TO_TIMESTAMP_TZ function converts a string to a timestamp with time zone.
sample: TO_TIMESTAMP_TZ('2003/12/13 10:13:18 -8:00', 'YYYY/MM/DD HH:MI:SS TZH:TZM') TO_TIMESTAMP_TZ('2003/DEC/13 10:13:18 -8:00', 'YYYY/MON/DD HH:MI:SS TZH:TZM')
